p: The cellular wall of the yeasts of the control tube show a strong blue showing the presence of chitin contained in the cell wall ( Figure 4A,B); the cell membrane is intact and the propidium iodide is excluded from viable cells ( Figure 4C), since the dye did not access DNA. Nevertheless, 10 mg/mL of the essential oil caused the loss of the integrity of the cell membrane, the propidium iodide easily penetrate the damaged permeable membranes of non-viable cells, and there was a binding of propidium iodide to DNA ( Figure 4E,F), which shows the damage in the cellular membrane of C. albicans by the essential oil of B. morelensis.
